00046 /*********************************************************************************************************//**

00052 }

00054 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00055  * @brief   This function handles Hard Fault exception.
00056  * @retval  None
00057  ************************************************************************************************************/
00058 void HardFault_Handler(void)
00059 {
00060   #if 1
00061 
00062   static vu32 gIsContinue = 0;
00063   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00064   /* For development FW, MCU run into the while loop when the hardfault occurred.                           */
00065   /* 1. Stack Checking                                                                                      */
00066   /*    When a hard fault exception occurs, MCU push following register into the stack (main or process     */
00067   /*    stack). Confirm R13(SP) value in the Register Window and typing it to the Memory Windows, you can   */
00068   /*    check following register, especially the PC value (indicate the last instruction before hard fault).*/
00069   /*    SP + 0x00    0x04    0x08    0x0C    0x10    0x14    0x18    0x1C                                   */
00070   /*           R0      R1      R2      R3     R12      LR      PC    xPSR                                   */
00071   while (gIsContinue == 0)
00072   {
00073   }
00074   /* 2. Step Out to Find the Clue                                                                           */
00075   /*    Change the variable "gIsContinue" to any other value than zero in a Local or Watch Window, then     */
00076   /*    step out the HardFault_Handler to reach the first instruction after the instruction which caused    */
00077   /*    the hard fault.                                                                                     */
00078   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 
00080   #else
00081 
00082   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00083   /* For production FW, you shall consider to reboot the system when hardfault occurred.                    */
00084   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00085   NVIC_SystemReset();
00086 
00087   #endif
00088 }
00089

00106 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00107  * @brief   This function handles SysTick Handler.
00108  * @retval  None
00109  ************************************************************************************************************/
00110 void SysTick_Handler(void)
00111 {
00112   /* Toggle LED1                                                                                            */
00113   HT32F_DVB_LEDToggle(HT_LED1);
00114 }
00115 
00116 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00117  * @brief   This function handles Event Wake Up interrupt.
00118  * @retval  None
00119  * @details The EXTI Event Wakeup interrupt handler as following:
00120  *    - Get PWRCU_BAKSR and RTC_SR
00121  *    - Check wakeup source:
00122  *      - If wakeup by the WAKEUP pin : Turn on LED2
00123  *      - If wakeup by the RTC Compare Match : Turn on LED3
00124  * @note The RTC_SR and PWRCU_BAKSR is clear by read action.
00125  ************************************************************************************************************/
00126 void EVWUP_IRQHandler(void)
00127 {
00128   u32 wBAKSR = PWRCU_GetFlagStatus();
00129 #ifndef USE_HT32F52230_SK
00130   u32 wRTCSR = RTC_GetFlagStatus();
00131 #endif
00132   if (wBAKSR & PWRCU_FLAG_PD)
00133   {
00134     /* Check wakeup source                                                                                  */
00135     if (wBAKSR & PWRCU_FLAG_WUP)
00136     {
00137       /* If wakeup by the WAKEUP pin : Turn on LED2                                                         */
00138       HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED2);
00139     }
00140 #ifndef USE_HT32F52230_SK
00141     if (wRTCSR & RTC_FLAG_CM)
00142     {
00143       /* If wakeup by the RTC Compare Match : Turn on LED3                                                  */
00144       HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED3);
00145     }
00146 #endif
00147   }
00148 }
00149 
00150 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00151  * @brief   This function handles KEY1 button interrupt.
00152  * @retval  None
00153  * @details The KEY1 interrupt handler as following:
00154  *    - Clear EXTI channel n flag.
00155  *    - Wait till WAKEUP pin inactive then enable WAKEUP pin function.
00156  *    - Wait till RTC count occurs.
00157  *    - Compare Match in 5 second.
00158  *    - Read to clear the RTC_SR register.
00159  *    - Request to enter Power Down Mode (Both the LDO and the DMOS are disable).
00160  ************************************************************************************************************/
00161 __STATIC_INLINE void KEY1_Button_Process(void)
00162 {
00163   if (EXTI_GetEdgeFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL))
00164   {
00165     /* Clear EXTI channel flag                                                                              */
00166     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00167 
00168     /* Wait till WAKEUP pin inactive                                                                        */
00169     {
00170     CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00171     CKCUClock.Bit.PB = 1;
00172     CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO = 1;
00173     CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00174     }
00175     AFIO_GPxConfig(WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_ID, WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_SYSTEM);
00176     while (HT32F_DVB_PBGetState(BUTTON_WAKEUP));
00177     PWRCU_WakeupPinCmd(ENABLE);
00178 
00179     #ifndef USE_HT32F52230_SK
00180     #if 1
00181     {
00182       u32 wRtcCounterTmp = 0;
00183       /* Wait till RTC count occurs                                                                         */
00184       wRtcCounterTmp = RTC_GetCounter();
00185       while (RTC_GetCounter() == wRtcCounterTmp);
00186 
00187       /* Compare Match in 5 second                                                                          */
00188       RTC_SetCompare(RTC_GetCounter()+ 5);
00189 
00190       /* Read to clear the RTC_SR register                                                                  */
00191       while (RTC_GetFlagStatus());
00192     }
00193     #endif
00194     #endif
00195 
00196     /* Request to enter Power Down Mode (Both the LDO and the DMOS are disable)                             */
00197     PWRCU_PowerDown();
00198   }
00199 }

00202 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00203  * @brief   This function handles EXTI interrupt.
00204  * @retval  None
00205  ************************************************************************************************************/
00206 void EXTI0_1_IRQHandler(void)
00207 {
00208   #if defined(USE_HT32F52253_SK)
00209   KEY1_Button_Process();
00210   #endif
00211 
00212   #if defined(USE_HT32F52341_SK)
00213   KEY1_Button_Process();
00214   #endif
00215 
00216   #if defined(USE_HT32F52352_SK)
00217   KEY1_Button_Process();
00218   #endif
00219 
00220   #if defined(USE_HT32F0006_DVB)
00221   KEY1_Button_Process();
00222   #endif
00223 
00224   #if defined(USE_BM53A367A_DVB)
00225   KEY1_Button_Process();
00226   #endif
00227 }
